reg:regulation.reg:title: Wood Innovation Design Centre Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 136/2014, June 26, 2014]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Wood Innovation Design Centre means the building constructed or to be constructed on Lots 5 to 8, Block 150, District Lot 343, Cariboo District, Plan 1268.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption from building code; regulation by modified building code
bcl:section.bcl:text: For so long as the Wood Innovation Design Centre satisfies section 3,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to paragraph (b), the Wood Innovation Design Centre is exempt from the British Columbia Building Code, and

the British Columbia Building Code established by the British Columbia Building Code Regulation, B.C. Reg. 264/2012, as that regulation read on September 7, 2012, with the amendments set out in the attached Schedule, applies to the Wood Innovation Design Centre.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 2, the Wood Innovation Design Centre must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: have a building area of not more than 1 125 m2, a building height of 6 storeys and floor areas that together total not more than 4 850 m2,
be not more than 30 m in height measured from grade to the highest point of the uppermost roof, and
have the following major occupancy classifications:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the first storey must be a Group A, Division 2 assembly occupancy or a Group D business and personal services occupancy;
the second storey must be a Group A, Division 2 assembly occupancy or a Group D business and personal services occupancy;
the third to sixth storeys must be Group D business and personal services occupancies.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The definitions in the British Columbia Building Code established by the British Columbia Building Code Regulation, B.C. Reg. 264/2012, as that regulation read on September 7, 2012, with the amendments set out in the attached Schedule, apply to this section.

bcl:centertext.in:em: The Schedule is exempt from publication. The Schedule sets out the changes to the British Columbia Building Code that apply to the Wood Innovation Design Centre. The text of the Schedule is available to read in Volume 55, No. 19 of the British Columbia Gazette, Part II and online at http://www.bclaws.ca/.
